thinking.disposable_income: Median household income is $69,810, with about 37.7% households earning less than $50,000. This suggests moderate disposable income but significant population segment that may be price-sensitive to transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution and average household size of 2.4, many families likely have limited discretionary spending. Higher sales taxes would impact household budgets, especially for lower-income residents
thinking.accessibility: Mixed transportation usage with 43.8% driving alone, 24.5% using transit, and 23.8% having no vehicle. Good balance of transit and driving needs to be considered. Location provides decent access to downtown and other areas
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized lower sales tax (0.5%) to protect discretionary spending power. 2. Balanced fare structures around $1.25 to maintain transit service quality without overburdening transit-dependent residents. 3. Moderate driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit times without excessive impact on drivers. 4. Selected proposals that reduce transit travel times to benefit the 24.5% transit users. 5. Considered the 23.8% car-free households who rely heavily on transit accessibility
